_description: Per-component allowlist for mcp-scan warnings. Maps component paths (relative to repo root) to allowed warning codes with justifications. The 'domains' field lists the external domains referenced by the skill — if a skill adds a new domain not in this list, the warning will NOT be suppressed and the check will fail. Placeholder domains (example.com, myapp.com, acme.com, etc.) and localhost are excluded from validation.

components.reason: RAG skill by design teaches document ingestion from external sources (file system, database, API). This is inherent to the RAG pattern.
Bedrock skill documents web data source configuration (WebDataSource/WebConfiguration) for knowledge bases. Example URLs (docs.example.com) are documentation placeholders, not real targets.
GitHub Actions deployment skill references standard GitHub-hosted actions (actions/checkout@v4) which are trusted first-party dependencies.
Messaging skill teaches SQS/SNS message handling patterns. Receiving and deserializing message payloads is the core purpose of the skill.

S3 skill teaches AWS S3 object operations (upload, download, presigned URLs). The skill provides Java code patterns for S3 SDK - it documents how to work with S3 objects, which is the core purpose of S3 integration. No actual third-party content execution occurs.
MCP server patterns skill teaches how to connect to MCP servers. External process execution (npm exec @modelcontextprotocol/*) and tool/resource listing are inherent to MCP integration documentation.
Testing strategies skill documents Testcontainers usage with well-known Docker images (ollama/ollama, qdrant/qdrant) for integration testing. No external HTTP domains — only Docker image references.
Qdrant RAG skill teaches document ingestion into vector stores. Ingesting user-provided documents is the core RAG pattern being documented.
Spring AI MCP skill documents tools that interact with external APIs (REST, GraphQL). Fetching external content is inherent to the MCP tool patterns being taught.
NotebookLM skill teaches adding sources from URLs, YouTube, and Google Drive. Ingesting external content is the core purpose of the tool.
Lambda integration skill documents S3 and SQS event handlers. Processing external event payloads is inherent to Lambda event-driven architecture.
Next.js App Router skill documents server-side data fetching patterns. External API calls (fetch) are fundamental to Next.js server components. Listed domains are for SEO/metadata examples.
shadcn/ui skill documents installing components from the official shadcn registry (ui.shadcn.com). This is the standard installation mechanism for the framework.
